intro: Atylus adenanthodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Atylus adenanthodes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and resilience.
